title: 7 Simple Steps to Craft a Stonecutter in Minecraft

steps.title: Launch a world in Minecraft.
steps.content: Launch a world in Minecraft. You can use Minecraft: Bedrock Edition or Java Edition.

steps.title: Gather your materials.
steps.content: Gather your materials. To create a stonecutter, you'll need 3 Cobblestone, 1 Iron Ingot, a furnace, and a crafting table. [1] X Research source Cobblestone can be found by mining stone blocks . Iron Ingot can be created by smelting iron ore in a furnace. A furnace can be crafted with 8 Cobblestone. A crafting table can be created with 4 wooden planks.

steps.title: Smelt 3 cobblestone blocks in a furnace.
steps.content: Smelt 3 cobblestone blocks in a furnace. When you smelt the cobblestone, it will convert into stone blocks. Make sure you have fuel to use the furnace .

steps.title: Open the crafting table.
steps.content: Open the crafting table. This will open a 3x3 grid.

steps.title: Place the 3 stone blocks in the middle row.
steps.content: Place the 3 stone blocks in the middle row. There should be one stone block in each cell of the middle row.

steps.title: Place the Iron Ingot in the center of the top row.
steps.content: Place the Iron Ingot in the center of the top row. When placed correctly, you'll see the stonecutter to the right of the arrow.

steps.title: Collect the stonecutter.
steps.content: Collect the stonecutter. Drag the stonecutter to place it into your inventory, or click it. You can now use the stonecutter to build stone-related items!
